ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I crafted my own podcast episode for the first time! I also learnt how to write a pitch, how to reach out to potential interviewees, how to carry out an interview, editing and scripting techniques...

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Readings were interesting, helpful, and relevant to our individual projects
Class environment was comfortable and supportive
Table reads were very helpful

Sometimes would have liked to devote more class time to podcast projects
Appreciated the very kind and positive feedback from instructor but project may have benefited from more constructive criticism (which did come from table read).

Strengths: The small classroom was great for brainstorming and feedback 
Weaknesses: We did not learn much about the technical aspects of producing a podcast. I would have enjoyed more guidance in terms of recording, editing, etc...

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes to someone who has any interest in podcasts (or written journalism) or is interested in learning audio editing skills.
Yes! If you have a project in mind that you have been wanting to carry out, this is a good opportunity to do so with some guidance.
